name: 2-pyridineacetamide
Reason: 2-pyridineacetamide has a melting point that we can compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a pyridine ring and an acetamide group. The pyridine ring introduces additional rigidity and pi-system interactions, estimated at around +20 °C. The acetamide group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point. The carbonyl group can also introduce a rigid structure, estimated at around +10 °C.
